intro: Lasiorrhiza oligocephala, commonly known as the narrow-headed mountain larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky slopes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are compound and finely divided, while its flowers are arranged in racemes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
